verses.text: When I \add would have\add* healed Israel, Then the iniquity of Ephraim was discovered, and the wickedness of Samaria: For they commit falsehood; and the thief cometh in, \add And\add* the troop \add of robbers\add* spoileth without.
And they consider not in their hearts \add That\add* I remember all their wickedness: Now their own doings have beset them about; They are before my face.
They make the king glad with their wickedness, And the princes with their lies.
They \add are\add* all adulterers, as an oven heated by the baker, \add Who\add* ceaseth from raising after \add he\add* hath kneaded the dough, until it be leavened.
\add In\add* the day of our king the princes have made \add him\add* sick \add with\add* bottles of wine; He stretched out his hand with scorners.
For they have made ready their heart like an oven, whiles they lie in wait: Their baker sleepeth all the night; \add In\add* the morning it burneth as a flaming fire.
They are all hot as an oven, And have devoured their judges; All their kings are fallen: \add There is\add* none among them that calleth unto me.
Ephraim, he hath mixed himself among the people; Ephraim is a cake not turned.
Strangers have devoured his strength, and he knoweth \add it\add* not: Yea, gray hairs are here and there upon him, yet he knoweth not.
And the pride of Israel testifieth to his face: And they do not return to the \sc Lord\sc* their God, nor seek him for all this.
Ephraim also is like a silly dove, without heart: They call \add to\add* Egypt, they go \add to\add* Assyria.
When they shall go, I will spread my net upon them; I will bring them down as the fowls of the heaven; I will chastise them, as their congregation hath heard.
Woe unto them! for they have fled from me: Destruction unto them! because they have transgressed against me: Though I have redeemed them, yet they have spoken lies against me.
And they have not cried unto me with their heart, When they howled upon their beds: They assemble themselves for corn and wine, \add And\add* they rebel against me.
Though I have bound \add and\add* strengthened their arms, Yet do they imagine mischief against me.

They return, \add but\add* not \add to\add* the most High: They are like a deceitful bow: Their princes shall fall by the sword for the rage of their tongue: This \add shall be\add* their derision in the land of Egypt.
